text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
illusion tea cup and saucer cake pop
tutorial we're going to be showing you
how to make this completely edible

complete with a sauce that and this

look like the little chunk of milk is
actually pouring straight into your cup
of tea or coffee to make the teacup part
of today's tutorial I've got some melted
dark chocolate you're going to need a
little bit of chocolate ganache so this
is basically two parts chocolate to one
part cream I will leave a small batch

below I've got some melted white
chocolate I've also got a couple of

and white today I've also got a pair of

brush I've got a fondant rolling pin
you'll need a cupcake case and
preferably not a really thin low-quality
one try and get a bit of a higher grade
cupcake case I've got a pretzel stick a
couple of toothpicks and a small circle
cutter off to the side I've also got
just a regular cupcake tray so let's get
started the first thing we're going to
prepare is our little teacup outer so
you want to take some of that dark
chocolate pour it into your cupcake case
and just use your pastry brush just to
spread it right other sides you want to
make sure that you're completely coating
the inside of that cupcake case and then
just pop it into your cupcake tray to
hold its shape off into the fridge to
let that set while that one's setting
you want to put a little bit more of

looking seas these are going to be for

sure you've got a few more of these and
you think you're going to need just in

going to take a little bit of that
melted white chocolate and we're going
to stick these pieces together make sure
you don't go too crazy on the white
chocolate here just put a little bit
sort of in the middle of your disk
because you don't want that to come
seeping out the sides in between your
white and blue layers
once you lay as a sandwich squeeze them
together quite tightly and then roll

to help your shape come together as one

it about two-thirds of the way in and
then give it a little shake down so that
melted white chocolate comes almost all
the way down to the bottom but it
doesn't have to go right to the bottom
take a little milk jug and I'm just
twisting the pretzel stick as I sort of
shove it into the top of that milk jug
and you want to make sure that your milk
jugs on a bit of an angle because no one

kind of got a go on an angle in the
direction that little spout is pouring
take your white chocolate and just put a
little bit more white chocolate kind of
around the pretzel stick where it meets

just rest the end of your pretzel stick
on something and let that dry by now
your little chocolate cupcake case
should be well and truly set so you just
want to kind of get your fingernails in
there a sharp knife and just separate
the cupcake wrapper from the actual
cupcake be kinda gentle here because you
don't want to crack it but they aren't
pretty sturdy you should now have your
nice little chocolate cupcake case and
you can discard your wrapper taking your
cake pop balls so we're using two here
one is the perfect size for a miniature
and two is the perfect size for large so
it depends on how big you want these

those two in and you want to have a gap
of about a centimeter or so from the top
of the rim make sure that your chocolate
ganache is really fluid but not at all
hot so it should be not even warm room
temperature and spoon a couple of

set the cake pop mix in there but it's
also going to give you that kind of cup
of coffee cup of tea effect now you want
to just put in just a little bit of
white chocolate and not too much here
and then with your toothpick you're just
going to swirl it around kind of roughly
in the center so this is supposed to
look like the milk as it's adding into
the cup of tea or coffee your pretzel
stick and milk jug should now be
completely set so before that melted
white chocolate starts to set you just
want to shove that all the way down into
your cake pop and then take one of your
little hair
and just put the tip of the handle into
the ganache and rest it on the side
finally to finish it off I just rolled
out a really tiny tiny little handle for
the milk jug kind of a little ball and
then we turn it into this little
horseshoe shape and then I'm going to
use just a fraction of white chocolate
or you can also use a little bit of

attach that milk jug handle on that's
your completed illusion teacup cake pop

you could use a raspberry jam anything

else
take your little cup it's about the same

put a little contrasting ball of fondant

and just cut it out this should be
almost exactly the same size as your
